Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water and light, showing it healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant with no water, showing how it looks unhealthy or wilted.
The student can draw a plant kept in the dark too long, showing how it looks unhealthy or not growing.
The student can represent in their drawing that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can identify and highlight patterns in their drawings that show the differences between plants with and without water and light.
